PyWFL.constant module¶

constants for pywfl

Module contents¶

PyWFL.factorial(n)[source]¶

Get \(n!=n \dot (n-1) \cdots 3 \dot 2 \dot 1\)

Parameters:n (int) – number to be calculated factorial.
Returns:get \(n!=n \dot (n-1) \cdots 3 \dot 2 \dot 1\)
Return type:float

Notes

Use recursive method to do factorial. FACTORIAL is slower than WFL_FACTORIAL when call it many times.
